Name: To Kill a Mockingbird
Synopsis: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South seen through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch.
Author: Harper Lee

Synopsis: A chilling depiction of a totalitarian society under the surveillance of Big Brother.
Author: George Orwell

Name: The Great Gatsby
Synopsis: A story of the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his quest to win back his former lover set in the Roaring Twenties.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Name: Pride and Prejudice
Synopsis: A romantic novel that critiques the British class system through the life and loves of Elizabeth Bennet.
Author: Jane Austen

Name: The Catcher in the Rye
Synopsis: A novel about teenage angst and alienation narrated by the troubled Holden Caulfield.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Synopsis: The first book in the Harry Potter series where a young wizard begins his journey at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Name: The Lord of the Rings
Synopsis: An epic fantasy trilogy about the quest to destroy a powerful ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Name: Jane Eyre
Synopsis: A coming-of-age story about a young orphaned girl who becomes a governess and falls in love with her employer.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Name: The Hobbit
Synopsis: A prelude to The Lord of the Rings where Bilbo Baggins goes on an adventure to help dwarves reclaim their homeland.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Name: Brave New World
Synopsis: A satirical novel about a technologically advanced society where humans are engineered for specific roles.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Name: The Chronicles of Narnia
Synopsis: A series of seven fantasy novels that revolve around the adventures of children in the magical land of Narnia.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Name: Fahrenheit 451
Synopsis: A novel about a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Name: Catch-22
Synopsis: A darkly humorous novel about World War II soldiers and the absurdities of war centered on the term 'Catch-22'.
Author: Joseph Heller

Name: Animal Farm
Synopsis: A fable about a group of farm animals who overthrow their human farmer only to face a new tyranny.
Author: George Orwell

Name: The Alchemist
Synopsis: A philosophical book about a shepherd named Santiago who dreams of finding a treasure and embarks on a journey of self-discovery.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Synopsis: A novel that chronicles the Buendía family's multi-generational saga in the fictional town of Macondo.
Author: Gabriel García Márquez

Name: The Shining
Synopsis: A chilling story about a family that becomes isolated in an haunted hotel and the father's descent into madness.
Author: Stephen King

Name: Lord of the Flies
Synopsis: A novel about a group of boys stranded on a deserted island who gradually descend into savagery.
Author: William Golding

Name: Les Miserables
Synopsis: A sweeping epic about redemption justice and the lives of various characters in post-revolutionary France.
Author: Victor Hugo

Name: Crime and Punishment
Synopsis: A novel about a young man who commits a murder and wrestles with his conscience and the consequences.
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

Name: The Da Vinci Code
Synopsis: A mystery thriller involving a conspiracy theory and secret societies connected to the Catholic Church.
Author: Dan Brown

Name: The Hunger Games
Synopsis: A dystopian novel about a televised death match in a future society where districts are controlled by the Capitol.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Name: The Road
Synopsis: A harrowing novel about a father and son journeying across a desolate landscape following an unspecified apocalypse.
Author: Cormac McCarthy

Name: Little Women
Synopsis: A novel about the lives loves and struggles of the March sisters during and after the American Civil War.
Author: Louisa May Alcott

Name: War and Peace
Synopsis: An epic novel that intertwines the lives of several families during the Napoleonic Wars in Russia.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Name: Anna Karenina
Synopsis: A novel about the tragic love affair of Anna Karenina and the societal expectations of 19th-century Russia.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Name: The Outsiders
Synopsis: A story about a gang of teenage boys and their struggles with societal expectations and class conflict.
Author: S.E. Hinton

Name: Ender's Game
Synopsis: A novel about a young boy trained in a military academy to fight in a future war against alien invaders.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Name: The Bell Jar
Synopsis: A semi-autobiographical novel about a young woman's struggle with mental illness.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Name: On the Road
Synopsis: A novel about the adventures and experiences of a group of friends traveling across America in the 1950s.
Author: Jack Kerouac

Name: The Giver
Synopsis: A story about a boy who learns about the dark truths of his seemingly perfect society and his role as the Receiver of Memory.
Author: Lois Lowry

Name: Life of Pi
Synopsis: A novel about a young boy stranded on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger exploring themes of survival and faith.
Author: Yann Martel

Name: The Kite Runner
Synopsis: A story about the friendship between two boys in Afghanistan and the impact of a betrayal on their lives.
Author: Khaled Hosseini

Name: The Secret Garden
Synopsis: A story about a young girl who discovers a hidden neglected garden and learns about healing and growth.
Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

Name: Dracula
Synopsis: A Gothic novel about Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England to spread the undead curse.
Author: Bram Stoker

Name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Synopsis: A novel about a man who remains eternally young while a portrait of him ages and shows his moral decay.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Name: Ulysses
Synopsis: A novel that explores a single day in the life of Leopold Bloom in Dublin using stream-of-consciousness narrative.
Author: James Joyce

Name: Slaughterhouse-Five
Synopsis: A novel about a soldier who becomes 'unstuck in time' and experiences different moments of his life including a bombing raid in Dresden.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Name: The Catcher in the Rye
Synopsis: A novel about teenage angst and alienation narrated by the troubled Holden Caulfield.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Name: The Little Prince
Synopsis: A philosophical tale about a young prince who travels from planet to planet and learns about love and responsibility.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Name: Charlotte's Web
Synopsis: A story about the friendship between a pig named Wilbur and a spider named Charlotte who helps him avoid being slaughtered.
Author: E.B. White

Name: The Chronicles of Narnia
Synopsis: A series of seven fantasy novels that revolve around the adventures of children in the magical land of Narnia.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Name: Cloud Atlas
Synopsis: A novel composed of six interconnected stories that span various genres and time periods.
Author: David Mitchell

Name: Rebecca
Synopsis: A novel about a young bride who is overshadowed by her husband's first wife and the secrets of their estate.
Author: Daphne du Maurier

Name: Persuasion
Synopsis: A romantic novel about a woman who is persuaded to break off an engagement and later regrets it.
Author: Jane Austen

Name: The Golden Compass
Synopsis: A young girl embarks on an adventure in a parallel universe to rescue her kidnapped friend and uncover a sinister plot.
Author: Philip Pullman

Name: Goodnight Moon
Synopsis: A classic bedtime story about a bunny saying goodnight to everything in his room.
Author: Margaret Wise Brown

Name: Hatchet
Synopsis: A novel about a boy who survives a plane crash and has to live alone in the wilderness with only a hatchet.
Author: Gary Paulsen

Name: Journey to the Center of the Earth
Synopsis: A novel about an expedition that travels to the Earth's core discovering a hidden world and its wonders.
Author: Jules Verne

Name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
Synopsis: A novella about a man with a dual personality one benevolent and the other malevolent.
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson

Name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
Synopsis: A collection of short stories featuring the famous detective Sherlock Holmes and his friend Dr. Watson.
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Synopsis: The second book in the Harry Potter series where Harry returns to Hogwarts and uncovers secrets about the Chamber of Secrets.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Name: Watership Down
Synopsis: A novel about a group of rabbits who leave their warren to seek a new home and face various challenges along the way.
Author: Richard Adams

Name: Redwall
Synopsis: A novel about the adventures of a young mouse and his quest to protect his abbey from a villainous rat.
Author: Brian Jacques
